subject: Art & Design
title: Photography Style in Branding
description: A quick, practical guide to Photography Style in Branding.

hook.text: Apple's product photos: white background, soft shadows, minimal props. Airbnb's: warm, natural light, real homes.

buildup.text: Brand photography guidelines define lighting, composition, subjects, color treatment, and emotional tone.

discovery.text: Stock photos can dilute a brand. Custom photography and consistent editing create authenticity and recognition.

twist.text: Some brands intentionally use imperfect, candid photography. Glossier's user-generated look builds relatability.

climax.text: A consistent photo style across website, social media, and ads creates subconscious brand recognition.

punchline.text: Your photos should be recognizable with the logo covered.

quiz.question: Why do some brands prefer imperfect, candid photography?
options: It builds relatability and authenticity with the audience
Cameras can't produce perfect images anymore
